clinical_study.brief_title: Therapy Pathways in the Treatment of Hormone Naïve Prostate Cancer Patients With and Without Comorbidities Treated With Degarelix or Luteinizing-Hormon-Releasing-Hormon (LHRH) Agonists.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to detect factors influencing decision making for treatment pathways of hormone-naïve prostate cancer patients with and without comorbidities receiving medicinal androgen deprivation therapy (Degarelix or LHRH agonists).

primary_outcome.measure: Level of urologist's knowledge of patients' medical history at the point of decision making and during Androgen Deprivation Therapy (ADT)
primary_outcome.description: Measured by questionnaires by quantifying the frequency of urologists' entries

primary_outcome.measure: Level of urologist's knowledge of patients' comorbidities at the point of decision making and during ADT
primary_outcome.description: Measured by questionnaires by quantifying the frequency of urologists' entries

primary_outcome.measure: Level of urologist's knowledge of patients' concomitant medications at the point of decision making and during ADT
primary_outcome.description: Measured by questionnaires by quantifying the frequency of urologists' entries

primary_outcome.measure: Level of urologist's knowledge of patients' risk factors at the point of decision making and during ADT
primary_outcome.description: Measured by questionnaires by quantifying the frequency of urologists' entries

study_pop.textblock: Patients with advanced prostate cancer where a treatment decision on therapy has already been made according to medical practice.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with Prostate Cancer and indicated for ADT according to Summary of Product Characteristics (SmPC)
- Decision made to prescribe ADT (Degarelix or LHRH agonist) prior to enrolment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient had previous or is currently under hormonal management of Prostate Cancer, except for a curative intention, where the duration of the neoadjuvant/adjuvant therapy did not exceed 6 months and treatment should have been terminated at least 6 months prior to baseline.
- Participation in a clinical trial at baseline and during the follow-up period
